sn56.32:4.2: ‘Without truly comprehending the noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, I will completely make an end of suffering.’
sn56.32:5.1: It’s as if someone was to say:
sn56.32:5.2: ‘I’ll make a basket out of acacia leaves or pine needles or myrobalan leaves, and use it to carry water or a palm frond.’
sn56.32:5.4: In the same way, suppose someone was to say:
sn56.32:5.5: ‘Without truly comprehending the noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, I will completely make an end of suffering.’
sn56.32:6.1: But suppose someone was to say:
sn56.32:6.2: ‘After truly comprehending the noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, I will completely make an end of suffering.’
sn56.32:7.1: It’s as if someone was to say:
sn56.32:7.2: ‘I’ll make a basket out of lotus leaves or flame-of-the-forest leaves or camel’s foot creeper leaves, and use it to carry water or a palm frond.’
sn56.32:7.4: In the same way, suppose someone was to say:
sn56.32:7.5: ‘After truly comprehending the noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path, I will completely make an end of suffering.’
sn56.32:8.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
